title: 113_hr1499
content: The Act titled "Disaster-Affected Homeowners Notification Act of 2013" requires notifying affected homeowners of mortgage relief. The Disaster-Affected Homeowners Notification Act of 2013 mandates direct and community-wide notification of mortgage relief in connection with major disasters declared under the Stafford Act. The Disaster-Affected Homeowners Notification Act of 2013 requires direct notification to mortgagors regarding covered mortgages, forbearance relief, and foreclosure moratoriums. The Disaster-Affected Homeowners Notification Act of 2013 mandates direct notification to mortgagors about covered mortgages, forbearance relief, and foreclosure moratoriums. Applicable agency heads must issue guidelines for community-wide notification measures in disaster-affected areas. Definitions for terms like "applicable agency head" are provided in the Act. The term "applicable agency head" refers to the Secretary for certain mortgages and the Director for others. A "covered mortgage" pertains to a mortgage secured by a one- to four-family dwelling that is the mortgagor's primary residence and located in an area affected by a major disaster declared under the Stafford Act. The term "Director" refers to the Director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency. "Forbearance relief" is defined as any suspension or reduction of mortgage payments. The term "mortgagee" refers to the original lender under the mortgage and any affiliates, agents, subsidiaries, successors, or assignees. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development. Guidelines will be issued within 30 days of the enactment of this Act. This Act applies to any major disaster declared under the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act. The Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act applies to Hurricane Sandy and any major disaster declared thereafter.
